title: Editors Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Thu Mar 8, 2018 | 1:35pm   
Israeli ultra-Orthodox Jewish men sit as a water canon is activated during a protest against the detention of a member of their community who refuses to serve in the Israeli army, in Jerusalem. REUTERS/Ronen Zvulun Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Israeli ultra-Orthodox Jewish men sit as a water canon is activated during a protest against the detention of a member of their community who refuses to serve in the Israeli army, in Jerusalem. REUTERS/Ronen Zvulun Close 1 / 28 
Women run during an event marking International Women's Day in Old Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. REUTERS/Faisal Al Nasser Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Women run during an event marking International Women's Day in Old Jeddah, Saudi Arabia. REUTERS/Faisal Al Nasser Close 2 / 28 
Paul Manafort (R), former campaign manager for U.S. President Donald Trump, arrives for an arraignment at the federal courthouse in Alexandria, Virginia. REUTERS/Brian Snyder Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Paul Manafort (R), former campaign manager for U.S. President Donald Trump, arrives for an arraignment at the federal courthouse in Alexandria, Virginia. REUTERS/Brian Snyder Close 3 / 28 
The forensic tent, covering the bench where Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia were found, is repositioned by officials in protective suits in the centre of Salisbury, Britain. REUTERS/Peter Nicholls Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 The forensic tent, covering the bench where Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia were found, is repositioned by officials in protective suits in the centre of Salisbury, Britain. REUTERS/Peter Nicholls Close 4 / 28 
A boy is seen in the besieged town of Douma, Eastern Ghouta, in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/Bassam Khabieh Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 A boy is seen in the besieged town of Douma, Eastern Ghouta, in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/Bassam Khabieh Close 5 / 28 
McDonald's 'M' logo is turned upside down in honour of International Women's Day in Lynwood, California. Courtesy McDonald's/via REUTERS Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 McDonald's 'M' logo is turned upside down in honour of International Women's Day in Lynwood, California. Courtesy McDonald's/via REUTERS Close 6 / 28 
Meghan Markle talks to a local schoolgirl during a walkabout with Britain's Prince Harry during a visit to Birmingham. REUTERS/Phil Noble Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Meghan Markle talks to a local schoolgirl during a walkabout with Britain's Prince Harry during a visit to Birmingham. REUTERS/Phil Noble Close 7 / 28 
The delegation and the team of North Korea arrive at The Paralympic Village in Pyeongchang, South Korea. OIS/IOC/Thomas Lovelock/via Reuters Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 The delegation and the team of North Korea arrive at The Paralympic Village in Pyeongchang, South Korea. OIS/IOC/Thomas Lovelock/via Reuters Close 8 / 28 
A man stands in front of a damaged mosque after a clash between two communities in Digana central district of Kandy, Sri Lanka. REUTERS/Dinuka Liyanawatte Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 A man stands in front of a damaged mosque after a clash between two communities in Digana central district of Kandy, Sri Lanka. REUTERS/Dinuka Liyanawatte Close 9 / 28 
With a rocket ship on the table, U.S. President Donald Trump speaks about the space program during a cabinet meeting at the White House. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 With a rocket ship on the table, U.S. President Donald Trump speaks about the space program during a cabinet meeting at the White House. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque Close 10 / 28 
An attendant is seen between curtains during the second plenary session of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC) at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing. REUTERS/Aly Song Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 An attendant is seen between curtains during the second plenary session of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC) at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing. REUTERS/Aly Song Close 11 / 28 
Claudia Kelleway lies with Ruby the Great Dane during the first day of the Crufts Dog Show in Birmingham. REUTERS/Darren Staples Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Claudia Kelleway lies with Ruby the Great Dane during the first day of the Crufts Dog Show in Birmingham. REUTERS/Darren Staples Close 
A pedestrian walks through Central Park during a snow storm in New York. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 A pedestrian walks through Central Park during a snow storm in New York. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson Close 13 / 28 
Anti riot policeman drags away a supporter of Sierra Leone People's Party (SLPP) during a protest against the police attempting to search the offices of Julius Maada Bio, the presidential candidate for (SLPP) in Freetown, Sierra Leone. REUTERS/Olivia... more Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 Anti riot policeman drags away a supporter of Sierra Leone People's Party (SLPP) during a protest against the police attempting to search the offices of Julius Maada Bio, the presidential candidate for (SLPP) in Freetown, Sierra Leone. REUTERS/Olivia Acland Close 14 / 28 
Female members of police commando march during a ceremony on International Women's Day, at the police headquarters in Islamabad, Pakistan. REUTERS/Faisal Mahmood Reuters / Thursday, March 08, 2018 Female members of police commando march during a ceremony on International Women's Day, at the police headquarters in Islamabad, Pakistan. REUTERS/Faisal Mahmood Close 15 / 28 
A U.S. Navy officer plays with Agent Orange victims at a hospice as part of the visit to Vietnam of U.S aircraft carrier USS Carl Vinson in Danang, Vietnam. REUTERS/Kham Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 A U.S. Navy officer plays with Agent Orange victims at a hospice as part of the visit to Vietnam of U.S aircraft carrier USS Carl Vinson in Danang, Vietnam. REUTERS/Kham Close 16 / 28 
Salisbury Cathedral, in the centre of the city in which former Russian intelligence officer Sergei Skripal and a woman were found unconscious after they had been exposed to an unknown substance is seen at dawn in Salisbury. REUTERS/Toby Melville Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 Salisbury Cathedral, in the centre of the city in which former Russian intelligence officer Sergei Skripal and a woman were found unconscious after they had been exposed to an unknown substance is seen at dawn in Salisbury. REUTERS/Toby Melville Close 17 / 28 
A voter casts her ballot at a polling station during Sierra Leone's general election in Freetown, Sierra Leone. REUTERS/Olivia Acland Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 A voter casts her ballot at a polling station during Sierra Leone's general election in Freetown, Sierra Leone. REUTERS/Olivia Acland Close 18 / 28 
A survivor of slavery who wished to remain anonymous poses for a picture in New Delhi, India. REUTERS/Cathal McNaughton Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 A survivor of slavery who wished to remain anonymous poses for a picture in New Delhi, India. REUTERS/Cathal McNaughton Close 19 / 28 
A   fighter gestures after Free Syrian Army forces took control of Kafr Jana village, north of Afrin,   Wednesday, March 07, 2018 A   fighter gestures after Free Syrian Army forces took control of Kafr Jana village, north of Afrin,   20 / 28 
Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May greets the Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia Mohammad bin Salman outside 10 Downing Street in London. REUTERS/Simon Dawson Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May greets the Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia Mohammad bin Salman outside 10 Downing Street in London. REUTERS/Simon Dawson Close 21 / 28 
People walk as the armed forces members patrol during an operation against drug dealers in Vila Kennedy slum in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. REUTERS/Pilar Olivares Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 People walk as the armed forces members patrol during an operation against drug dealers in Vila Kennedy slum in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. REUTERS/Pilar Olivares Close 22 / 28 
An acid attack survivor has her makeup done backstage prior to a fashion show to mark International Women's Day in Thane on the outskirts of Mumbai, India. REUTERS/Danish Siddiqui Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 An acid attack survivor has her makeup done backstage prior to a fashion show to mark International Women's Day in Thane on the outskirts of Mumbai, India. REUTERS/Danish Siddiqui Close 23 / 28 
A woman touches the jersey of Fiorentina soccer player Davide Astori as she pays her respects outside the Artemio Franchi stadium in Florence, Italy. REUTERS/Alessandro Bianchi Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 A woman touches the jersey of Fiorentina soccer player Davide Astori as she pays her respects outside the Artemio Franchi stadium in Florence, Italy. REUTERS/Alessandro Bianchi Close 24 / 28 
Detained Reuters journalist Kyaw Soe Oo is escorted by police after a court hearing in Yangon, Myanmar. REUTERS/Stringer Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 Detained Reuters journalist Kyaw Soe Oo is escorted by police after a court hearing in Yangon, Myanmar. REUTERS/Stringer Close 25 / 28 
A fighter aircraft is seen in the wreckage of the sunken USS Lexington, a World War Two U.S. Navy aircraft carrier. PAUL G. ALLEN/via REUTERS Reuters / Tuesday, March 06, 2018 A fighter aircraft is seen in the wreckage of the sunken USS Lexington, a World War Two U.S. Navy aircraft carrier. PAUL G. ALLEN/via REUTERS Close 26 / 28 
A Palestinian woman reacts from tear gas fired by Israeli troops during clashes at a protest against U.S. President Donald Trump's decision on Jerusalem ahead of International Women's Day, in Ramallah, in the occupied West Bank. REUTERS/Mohamad... more Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 A Palestinian woman reacts from tear gas fired by Israeli troops during clashes at a protest against U.S. President Donald Trump's decision on Jerusalem ahead of International Women's Day, in Ramallah, in the occupied West Bank. REUTERS/Mohamad Torokman Close 27 / 28 
Recording artist Lionel Richie shows his hands after placing them in cement during a ceremony in the forecourt of the TCL Chinese theatre in Los Angeles, California. REUTERS/Mario Anzuoni Reuters / Wednesday, March 07, 2018 Recording artist Lionel Richie shows his hands after placing them in cement during a ceremony in the forecourt of the TCL Chinese theatre in Los Angeles, California. REUTERS/Mario Anzuoni Close
